name: accumulate
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to collect a large number of things over a long period of time

example.eg: As people accumulate more wealth, they tend to spend a greater proportion of their incomes.
example.egtrans: 人们积累了更多财富后，他们的花费占收入的比重也往往会增加。

example.eg: The company said the debt was accumulated during its acquisition of nine individual businesses.
example.egtrans: 该公司称其在收购9家个体公司的过程中，债务越积越多。

example.eg: We've accumulated so much rubbish over the years.
example.egtrans: 多年来我们已经堆积了这么多的垃圾。

trans_examp.trans_en: to gradually increase in number or amount

example.eg: A thick layer of dust had accumulated in the room.
example.egtrans: 房间里积了厚厚一层灰尘。

example.eg: If you don't go through the papers on your desk on a regular basis, they just keep on accumulating.
example.egtrans: 如果你不去定期整理办公桌上的文件，它们就会越积越多。
